title: Perma Banned for 3rd Party Software (I've never used 3rd Party Software.....)
body:
Has this happened to anyone else?

I opened my e-mail this morning to find that riot had issued a perma ban for "use of 3rd party software." I was not told what type of software I was being accused of using, and I have not even logged into the game in over a week, last I played was 3/6/2019. However, I see two newer games in my match history that confirm (for me) that my account was definitely hacked, and whoever it was was definitely scripting judging by the stats for reach game.

This honestly pisses me off, because I'm essentially being preyed on by some phisher or hacker with nothing better to do.

This is just more of a "has it happened to you" post. I'm already trying to contact Riot, but I already have a sinking feeling that they won't even bother with me at this point. 

I had a good run I guess, thank you for the fun Riot. From Season 3 to current.

I shouldn't be held responsible for the actions of a bot. There's no way you can possibly justify that. In any case, per riot customer support, there was a massive bot wave recently and they are investigating. Riot can tell what IP the account is logged in from, which is more than enough evidence to clear me of wrongdoing.

>I shouldn't be held responsible for the actions of a bot.

What bot? The Riot system? Cause it's not usually at fault.  If it was indeed another player that took over the account and used something they weren't supposed too (i.e. against the ToU of the game) then it's still you that's at fault for not keeping your account under watch.

>Riot can tell what IP the account is logged in from, which is more than enough evidence to clear me of wrongdoing.

That's not necessarily true, cause if it were then many of these bans that happen could easily be undone or stand true. They use many other methods, that they don't disclose, to determine if the ban is placed properly.  Most of the time though, they don't reverse permabans unless it was absolutely placed in error. So all you can do is wait.

 bot as in whoever was using script exploits on my account (scripting according to the riot rep I'm currently in contact with anyway...)

But no, I don't believe I should be held responsible for it since it wasn't me. I keep my machine fairly tight. I don't touch suspicious links, I have up to date anti-virus, my router is protected, my password has a very diverse cast (lol). It seems to me like at some point a player can only do so much to protect themselves. This is where the company steps in to verify if the account holder was the one actually exploiting (which is currently underway.)

>This is where the company steps in to verify if the account holder was the one actually exploiting (which is currently underway.)

Yes, but from what has been seen around the forums  over the years from various incidents like this Riot doesn't really take much difference in if it was the Owner of the account vs Someone else. They will hold both sides responsible.

I even remember a recent one about a ban similar to this where they showed the ticket that even said "Nothing suspicious was found on the account" but they would not reverse the ban.
I suppose we will see how it goes then. Hopefully well, since I've seen several players here reporting the same issue.

Some could possibly be lying as well, since it's hard for anyone here to really know whats what.  Riot always send out bans in waves at the start and end of the years, and tons of the people do tend to flock to the forums right after.
In a way I hope that's the case, because I'd have to see other folks who were compromised get banned and have to start all over.

When my west account got banned. I haven't even played with that in months, and it's match history is empty since the past several months! So no one played with it since a while. Had to send a damn support ticket to unban it.

Same thing happened to me. Haven't been on for LOL for 2 or 3 days, come back and I get a notification saying that I have been permanently banned for prohibited third party software. I have never used any third party software, I don't even play ranked. Why the hell would I need any third party software? I play the game to purely have fun and I don't recall ever being genuinely mad at the game because of this gaming mentality of mine. If I've been hacked like what happened to you, I want to know how I can find that out. 

Riot, if you read this, please help me figure this out.

Thanks.
Yeah ive been banned the same.

If it's proved the account was compromised through no fault of yours (you took reasonable precautions and never shared login info) and that you are the original owner of the account (not accusing, but purchased account are notorious for having been leveled through botting, even if the purchaser never bots/scripts) there is a decent chance you'll get your account back.
All I can do at this point is give whatever info they ask for and hope for good news. lol
This is why I wish two factor authorizations were a thing... I'd gladly spend an extra 30 seconds logging into the client each time if it meant my account be safe from this sort of stuff.

I agree. That's the reason I added an authenticator (physical at first) to my Blizzard account back when gold farmers were compromising hundreds of accounts every week. I literally bought the damn thing on impulse. Never had an account issue since.

Ok, apparently Riot was hit with a massive bot wave that turned up a lot of false positives and they are reviewing tickets still.

I hope everyone who has experienced this reads this.

There is hope!
